TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Clock extends System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject

summary.span: 维护 的运行时时序状态。

span.span: Maintains run-time timing state for a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个，其本身而言，实际上没有任何除了描述时间段。A , by itself, doesn't actually do anything other than describe a segment of time. 时间线的对象执行实际工作： 它保留为时间线计时相关运行时状态。It's the timeline's object that does the real work: it maintains timing-related run-time state for the timeline. 在大多数情况下，创建时钟会自动为时间线。In most cases, a clock is created automatically for your timeline. 当您使用进行动画处理或方法中，自动为时间线和动画创建时钟并应用于其目标属性。When you animate by using a or the method, clocks are automatically created for your timelines and animations and applied to their targeted properties. 有关示例，请参阅[如何： 使用演示图板对属性进行动画处理](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-animate-a-property-by-using-a-storyboard.md)并[如何： 进行动画处理属性而不使用情节提要](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-animate-a-property-without-using-a-storyboard.md)。For examples, see [How to: Animate a Property by Using a Storyboard](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-animate-a-property-by-using-a-storyboard.md) and [How to: Animate a Property Without Using a Storyboard](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-animate-a-property-without-using-a-storyboard.md). 此外可以创建通过使用显式方法。You can also create a explicitly by using the method. 需要进行大量性能的情况下，例如对大量类似对象进行动画处理管理你自己使用可以提供性能优势。In performance-intensive scenarios, such as animating large numbers of similar objects, managing your own use can provide performance benefits. 在匹配的结构的树中排列时钟从中创建树对象。Clocks are arranged in trees that match the structure of the objects tree from which they are created. 此类一个计时树的根时钟可以以交互方式操作 （暂停、 恢复、 已停止，等等） 通过检索其。The root clock of such a timing tree can be interactively manipulated (paused, resumed, stopped, and so on) by retrieving its . 不能直接控制非根时钟。Non-root clocks cannot be directly controlled. 一旦创建，就不能修改时钟 （但可以对其进行处理）。Once created, a clock cannot be modified (but it can be manipulated). ## 作为计时器使用时间线Using a Timeline as a Timer 与之关联的事件处理程序时，才会前进时间线的时钟或 (对于对象) 是与属性关联。A timeline's clock will only progress when there's an event handler associated with it or (in the case of an object) it is associated with a property. 对于此原因 （以及其他），建议不要使用作为计时器。For this reason (and others), it's not recommended that you use a as a timer.

span.para: 派生的类应实现如果用户想要修改此时钟的时间的流动方式。派生的类可用于时钟重复、 跳过、 查找、 开始、 暂停、 继续时，或通过重写停止时执行其他工作， ，和方法。

Derived classes should implement if they want to modify how time flows for this clock. Derived classes can be made to do additional work when the clock repeats, skips, seeks, begins, pauses, resumes, or stops by overriding the , , and methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline timeline) cil managed

param.name: timeline

span.span: The from which this clock should be constructed.

param.span: 将不再为任何已具有时钟的子 对象创建时钟。

span.span: Clocks are not created for any child objects, if they exist.

summary.span: 使用指定的 作为模板来初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class, using the specified as a template.

summary.span: 新的 对象没有子级。

span.span: The new object has no children.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event Completed As EventHandler

summary.span: 当此时钟完全播放完毕时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this clock has completely finished playing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果此时钟为时钟树的根时钟，播放完后到达其活动持续时间 （其中包括重复） 结束且其所有子项都达到其活动持续时间结束。If this clock is the root clock of a clock tree, it has completed playing after it reaches the end of its active duration (which includes repeats) and all its children have reached the end of their active durations. 如果此时钟为子时钟，则是被视为完全完成播放时达到它所属时钟树的根时钟的结束其活动持续时间和所有子时钟已完成播放。If this clock is a child clock, it is considered to have completely finished playing when the root clock of the clock tree to which it belongs reaches the end of its active duration and all its child clocks have finished playing. 正在停止时钟不会触发它的完成的事件，但提前到其填充期。Stopping a clock does not trigger its completed event, but advancing it to its fill period does.

value.span: 如果这是根时钟，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: A if this is a root clock; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以以交互方式控制仅根时钟。Only root clocks can be interactively controlled.

span.span: The rate at which this clock's time is current progressing, compared to real-world time.

value.span: 如果该时钟已停止，则此属性返回 。

span.span: If the clock is stopped, this property returns .

summary.span: 在更新时钟速度时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the clock's speed is updated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 暂停、 恢复、 反转、 加速、 减速、 查找、 停止或更改时钟的交互速度使用触发此事件。Pausing, resuming, reversing, accelerating, decelerating, seeking, stopping, or changing a clock's interactive speed using a triggers this event. 虽然此事件发生时属性变为无效，并不一定意味着更改的属性。Although this event occurs when the property becomes invalid, that doesn't necessarily mean the property changed.

summary.span: 获取此时钟的当前迭代。

span.span: Get the current iteration of this clock.

value.span: 此时钟在其当前活动期中的当前迭代，如果此时钟已停止，则为 。

span.span: This clock's current iteration within its current active period, or if this clock is stopped.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 时钟的第一次迭代的值为 1。A clock's first iteration has a value of 1. 如果此时钟的时间线具有设置的`true`、 完整的迭代包含正向和反向迭代，而不仅仅是其中一个段。If this clock's timeline has an setting of `true`, a full iteration consists of a forward-reverse pair, not just one of these segments. 而不考虑其当前迭代中，定位时钟都会将其当前迭代为 1。Regardless of its current iteration, seeking a clock returns its current iteration to 1. 重新启动时钟也为 1 返回其当前迭代。Restarting a clock also returns its current iteration to 1.

summary.span: 获取此 在其当前迭代中的当前进度。

span.span: Gets the current progress of this within its current iteration.

value.span: 如果此时钟为 ，则为 ；如果此时钟处于活动状态并且其 具有 的 ，则为 0.0；否则为一个介于 0.0 和 1.0 之间的值，该值表示此时钟在其当前迭代中的当前进度。

span.span: if this clock is , or 0.0 if this clock is active and its has a of ; otherwise, a value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates the current progress of this Clock within its current iteration.

value.span: 值为 0.0 时表示没有进度，值为 1.0 时表示此时钟处于其当前迭代的末尾。

span.span: A value of 0.0 indicates no progress, and a value of 1.0 indicates that the clock is at the end of its current iteration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性的值指示通过规范化此时钟的。The value of this property indicates the normalized by the of this clock's . 是一个时钟具有为 1.0。A clock that is has a of 1.0. ## 作为计时器使用时间线Using a Timeline as a Timer 与之关联的事件处理程序时，才会前进时间线的时钟或 (对于对象) 是与属性关联。A timeline's clock will only progress when there's an event hander associated with it or (in the case of an object) it is associated with a property. 对于此原因 （以及其他），建议不要使用作为计时器。For this reason (and others), it's not recommended that you use a as a timer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请注意，时钟属性不会告诉你它是否已暂停。Note the clock's property doesn't tell you whether it's paused. 若要确定是否已暂停时钟，请使用属性。To determine whether a clock is paused, use the property. 每当此属性的值更改时发生。The occurs whenever the value of this property changes.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event CurrentStateInvalidated As EventHandler

summary.span: 当更新时钟的 属性时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the clock's property is updated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用事件时想要被通知在时钟开始时，如果停止或填充。Use the event when you want to be notified if when the clock starts, stops, or fills. 的参数事件处理程序是其状态已失效。The parameter of the event handler is the whose state was invalidated. 暂停不会更改其。Pausing a does not change its . 若要在一个时钟变为暂停时收到通知，请使用事件。To be notified when a clock becomes paused, use the event. 虽然此事件发生时变为无效，并不一定意味着更改：从用于切换到，然后返回在同一个计时周期将导致此事件激发，但其属性实际上不会更改。Although this event occurs when the becomes invalid, that doesn't necessarily mean the changed: a that switches from to and then back to in the same tick will cause this event to fire, but its property won't actually change.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 媒体使用正在播放内是创建的示例会具有外部时间源 （例如视频剪辑） 可能需要与其他时间线内同步。Media being played using within a is an example of creating a that would have an external time source (a video clip for example) which may require synchronization with other timelines within the . 有关更多信息，请参见。See for more information.

span.para: 如果用户想要修改它们如何确定当前时间，派生的类应重写此方法。
Derived classes should override this method if they want to modify how they determine the current time.
